DOC.criteria: Female male patient ≥ 18 year age A clinical diagnosis chronic congestive heart failure > 6 month At least one episode document ADHF previous 6 month NYHA functional class IIIIV Circulating level NTproBNP ≥ 800 ng/L . Stable , optimized therapy heart failure least 4 week prior enrollment Echocardiography perform within 3 month Detectable ascites ultrasound and/or compute tomography Diuretic resistance define daily dose furosemide > 80 mg , torsemide > 40 mg bumetanide > 2 mg Written inform consent Present recur systemic local infection , peritonitis , urinary tract infection , abdominal skin infection . Ongoing malignant disease adverse prognosis Evidence firmly loculated peritoneal effusion . Obstructive uropathy Severely reduced renal function ( SCreatinine 300 mol/l ) endstage renal disease require dialysis Severe liver disease ( ASAT and/or ALAT and/or total bilirubin three time upper limit normal range laboratory value ) Pregnancy Requirement intravenous inotropes Acute coronary syndrome condition require emergency treatment Heart disease require surgical intervention course study Any clinically significant disease could adversely affect study participation judge Investigator
